Unnamed: 3: 5 Star NABERS energy Commercial Property portfolio average by asset class.
Unnamed: 8: We achieved 4.7 stars in Retail and 5.0 stars in workplace for NABERS Energy, on our way to achieving 5 Star in FY24.\nWe continued to invest in energy efficieny initatives of close to $950,000 in FY23.

Unnamed: 3: 10 per cent improvement in FY20 carbon intensity and 5 per cent improvement in FY20 energy intensity for Commercial Property.
Unnamed: 8: Since FY20, we have acheived a 12.7 per cent reduction in emissions intensity, however, there is a 0.14% increase in energy intensity due to a return to pre-COVID activity.

Unnamed: 3: All Town Centres to offer electric vehicle charging stations.
Unnamed: 8: We continue to investigate opportunites to scale our investment in electric vehicle charnging stations across our Town Centre.

Unnamed: 3: Medium Density developments to exceed minimum National Construction Code (NCC) energy related compliance standards by 25 per cent.
Unnamed: 8: In FY23 our Medium Density developments have exceeded NCC (2022) by 52% improvement for Energy. The NCC was updated in 2022 to lift the performance standards. This target has been superceeded by the new standard.

Unnamed: 3: All new Apartments to exceed minimum NCC energy related compliance standards by 10 per cent.
Unnamed: 8: There were no new Apartments projects delivered in FY23. The NCC was updated in 2022 to lift the performance standards. This target has been superceeded by the new standard.

Unnamed: 3: All new Net Zero Carbon built form homes by 2030.
Unnamed: 8: We have previously piloted Green Star homes on an individual project which targeted net zero carbon outcomes. Our new ESG strategy seeks greater impact across our portfolio with science-based targets for decarbonisation towards net zero, and a focus on reducing emissions in the use of sold product (Scope 3, Cat 11) for homes. Individual developments may additionally pursue separate net zero carbon certification. In alignment with our decarbonisation targets we will no longer pursue this target.

Unnamed: 1: Enable our value chain to deliver better quality built form.
Unnamed: 3: All new Workplace and Town Centre developments to achieve a minimum 5 star Green Star rating.
Unnamed: 8: Our new Workplace developments at Stockland Piccadilly (NSW), M_Park Buildings A, C and D (NSW) and Affinity Place (NSW) are targeting 6 stars.

Unnamed: 3: All new Logistics developments to achieve a minimum 4 star Green Star rating.
Unnamed: 8: All Logistics developments are registered for 5 star Green Star ratings, with the exception of Yatala which is currently registered for 4 Stars.

Unnamed: 3: All new Masterplanned Communities (over 1,000 lots) to achieve a Green Star rating.
Unnamed: 8: Masterplanned communities in the early stages of development are reviewing the requirements associated with Green Star submissions. Our Providence (Qld) community is registered for Green Star Communities. We will review the proposed updates Green Star Communities to confirm our ongoing approach.

Unnamed: 1: Embed asset and community scale resilience for our portfolio
Unnamed: 3: Continue to conduct resilience assessments on all new and high priority assets.
Unnamed: 8: As of FY23, 100% of our assets and development projects have completed an asset level climate risk assessment.

Unnamed: 8: All assessed assets achieved, as a minimum, a moderate resilience rating.

Unnamed: 3: All new Masterplanned Communities to include a minimum 10 per cent total tree canopy cover (to reduce urban heat island).
Unnamed: 8: During FY23, several new Masterplanned Communities have committed to tree canopy cover targets beyond a minimum 10 per cent.

Unnamed: 3: All new Masterplanned Communities developments to include options for light coloured or reflective roofs including demonstration in display villages.
Unnamed: 8: Our Better Places Manual is used to embed these requirements and to help our project teams in the design and delivery of their Masterplanned Communities development.

Unnamed: 1: Adopt and implement circular models with stakeholders.
Unnamed: 3: Eliminate Single Use Plastics across Corporate Offices.
Unnamed: 8: Our Corporate Procurement team continues to review and eliminate single use plastics. Where possible, sustainable alternatives have been selected to replace products with plastics either in packaging or production.

Unnamed: 3: Conduct NABERS Waste ratings on Workplace portfolio.
Unnamed: 8: In FY23 we continued to conduct NABERS Waste ratings on the Workplace Portfolio

Unnamed: 3: 30 per cent of new Masterplanned Communities projects to trial sustainable asphalt roads.
Unnamed: 8: In FY23, we have continued to trial and roll out sustainable asphalt roads across our Masterplanned Communities including Elara (NSW) and Altrove (NSW). The use of lower-carbon materials will continue to be a focus as part of our Scope 3 targets.

Unnamed: 3: Deliver composting partnerships across all communities.
Unnamed: 8: In September 2022, after a successful pilot, we have formed a partnership with Compost Revolution to deliver composting solutions across our residential communities. The program has been launched across 37 of StocklandÃ¢ÂÂs communities.This target will change to align with refreshed ESG Strategy and approach to Social Impact.

Unnamed: 1: Reduce embodied impacts through improved lifecycle analysis.
Unnamed: 3: Complete 3 Lifecycle Assessments (LCA) on our built form home designs to identify a 10 per cent reduction in embodied impacts.
Unnamed: 8: In FY23 to develop baseline conditions for our decarbonisation pathway we completed LCAs across our built form home designs. During the FY22-24 target period we have completed LCAs for six built form projects. Will will measure our upfront carbon as part of our Scope 3 commitments.

Unnamed: 3: Establish minimum standards for material suppliers against Modern Slavery, Health and Safety, and Embodied Carbon criteria.
Unnamed: 8: To measure and track our new carbon targets we are developing LCA embodied carbon standards. See modern slavery statement for supply chain impacts.

Unnamed: 3: 4 Star NABERS Water Workplace portfolio average.

Unnamed: 3: All new Masterplanned Communities projects propose water cycle efficiency options.
